job.title: RF Systems Integration Engineer WiFi Bluetooth
job.description: <br><strong>Summary<br></strong> <br>Do you want to impact billions of users by developing an extraordinary product with a prime focus on wireless accuracy and performance? You will become part of a hands-on development team that furthers engineering perfection, creativity, and innovation. Dynamic, inspiring people and innovative technologies are the norm here. We want you to join our team if you are a resourceful engineer with the desire to research and develop solutions that do not yet exist. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.<br><br> <br><strong>Key Qualifications<br></strong> <br>Excellent understanding of RF fundamentals and communications theory<br><br>Solid fundamentals and relevant work experience programming in C or C++<br><br>You have a good working knowledge of RF calibrations and RF metrics<br><br>You understand antenna OTA testing<br><br>Hands-on experience with RF lab equipment including: spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, vector signal generators, power sensors, switch controllers, etc.<br><br>Your basic understanding of the WiFi and Bluetooth standards especially on the physical layer<br><br>We value your energy and drive to thrive because we operate like start-up environment<br><br>Knowledge of Object Oriented Programming (OOP) concepts &amp; scalable software design principles<br><br>You love domestic and overseas traveling<br><br> <br><strong>Description<br></strong> <br>You will have the opportunity to contribute to the design and validation of RF systems across Apple’s newest products including iPhones, Watches, iPads and others. You will advance a system to guarantee the optimal and the most consistent RF performance for all Apple products. The design of such a system requires good RF fundamentals, communications theory background, and sound programing practices. This entails working closely across multiple Apple teams, chipset vendors, instrument vendors and contract manufacturers.<br><br><br>KEY QUALIFICATIONS:<br><br>- Excellent understanding of RF fundamentals and communications theory<br><br>- Ability to write efficient, scalable C or C++ code<br><br>- You have a good working knowledge of RF calibrations and RF metrics<br><br>- Understanding of antenna OTA testing<br><br>- Hands-on experience with RF lab equipment including: spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, vector signal generators, power sensors, etc.<br><br>- Basic understanding of the WiFi and Bluetooth standards especially on the physical layer<br><br>- Strong energy and drive to thrive in a start-up like environment<br><br>- Knowledge of Object Oriented Programming (OOP) concepts &amp; scalable software design principles<br><br>- Passion for domestic and overseas travel<br><br><br>We see the more you have to the following as a BONUS:<br><br>- 3+ years of industry experience or equivalent<br><br>- Recent experience in developing test solutions for various wireless technologies<br><br>- Recent experience developing new software applications or drivers on any platform<br><br>- Recent experience with current and upcoming wireless RF standards (e.g. WiFi 802.11ax, 802.11ay, Bluetooth 5.0, 5G)<br><br>- Proven track record designing calibration algorithms for Tx Power, RSSI, pre-distortion, or IQ mismatch<br><br>- Familiarity with tools that enable high volume manufacturing of these technologies<br><br>- Ability to write and maintain scripts in one or more of these languages: Python, PERL, or Ruby<br><br>- Experience with machine learning and big data analysis<br><br>- Experience with web design and related technologies (html, javascript, SQL, mongo-db)<br><br> <br><strong>Education &amp; Experience<br></strong> <br>Your BSEE is needed and we highly value MSEE<br><br> <br>Role Number: 200002916<br><br>
